en.sc1: Let's look at the below example to see the difference between shallow and deep copying.
en.sc2: First, create a Employee, Sam, and shallow copy firstEmployee to the shallowCopyEmployee which is a new Employee reference.
en.sc3: Now, using setName() method, update the Employee object's name as "John", which shallowCopyEmployee is pointing to.
en.sc4: If you print out the name of the firstEmployee, now you will see that the name of the Employee is now "John," not "Sam.".
en.sc5: Now, you will create 2 Employee objects secondEmployee and deepCopyEmployee. Set the name of secondEmployee as "Patrice."
en.sc6: After that, copy the name of the seconEmployee and set the name as deepCopyEmployee's name. So you deep-copied secondEmployee.
en.sc8: Finally, if you print the name of the secondEmployee's name, it is stil "Patrice" and changeing deepCopyEmployee's name did not effect any to secondEmployee's variable.
